alert.note: Alert for Panola (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 2:00PM CDT until May 14 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Panola, Rusk and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Henderson, Carthage, Tenaha, Beckville, Joaquin, Pinehill, Minden, Joinerville, Turnertown, Gary City, Fairplay, Dotson, Chapman, Church Hill, Woods, Paxton, Brachfield, Deadwood, Laneville and Front.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
